issue.title: [CF 1138] 3 braces to submit examples
issue.body:
There's a post on rules for posting.
http://wow.curseforge.com/addons/tellmewhen/forum/general/25220-how-to-contribute-examples/#p1

It says to use 3 braces surrounding the code.

I've been doing it so far, but most of the errors I get from people are that the code appears to trail and cut off.

I'm using <<code>>  <</code>> now and it appears to show the string in a more familiar format.

Requesting update the forum post.


> Posted by CurseForge user Distractor_Beam | Imported from CurseForge issue #1138 | Raw

comments.body:
Don't put newlines between the braces and the string - they should all be on one line. I updated http://wow.curseforge.com/addons/tellmewhen/forum/mage/78344-frost-fire-by-distractor_beam/#p1 as an example.

If you use code tags, the string is going to get some weird highlighting as it tries to get parsed as Lua.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

That makes perfect sense.

Thanks again my man.


> Posted by CurseForge user Distractor_Beam
